concepts: Database is an organized collection of structured information stored electronically
DBMS software manages database creation, maintenance, and access operations
Relational databases organize data in tables with rows and columns
Primary keys uniquely identify each record in a database table
SELECT statement retrieves data from one or more database tables
INSERT statement adds new records to database tables
UPDATE statement modifies existing records in tables
DELETE statement removes records from database tables
Normalization reduces data redundancy and improves data integrity
Entity-Relationship diagrams model database structure and relationships
Foreign keys establish relationships between different tables
Indexing improves query performance by creating fast access paths
